text: If you’re just getting started with golf, the first rule of buying golf balls is quantity over quality. You will buy the balls, but you may not own them for long. Your first rounds of golf will most likely involve lakes, creeks, woods, and potentially random yards of strangers. In other words, don’t get too attached.

text: Building out your golf equipment is part of the fun of enjoying this great sport. You don’t need to buy everything at once and you can definitely use techniques to find discount golf equipment. Enjoy the process of finding the products that work the best for your game.
